Ansible Roles Deep Dive

Feb 21, 2024

About Ansible Roles

Here we talk about Ansible Roles, as Ansible is powerful configuration automation tool by running playpook, in addition organizing multiple Ansible contents and playbooks into roles provides a structural and more manageable way to achieve complex tasks for multiple targets or groups.

===================================================================

Ansible Roles can be created by:

  • Method1: Create Ansible roles by ansible-galaxy

Quickly creating a well-defined role directory structure skeleton, we can leverage the command ansible-galaxy init

defaults: This directory can contain default variables for the role.

files: This directory can contain static files that you want to copy to the target hosts.

handlers: This directory can contain handlers, which are tasks triggered by other tasks.

meta: This directory can contain metadata for the role, such as dependencies.

tasks: This directory contains a main.yaml file, which includes tasks specific to the “server1” role.

templates: This directory can contain Jinja2 templates.

vars: This directory can contain variables specific to the “server1” role

===================================================================

  • Method2: Manually create roles (server1 & server2) by create necessary folder structure and Setting up 2 server groups in ansible inventory file：
  • define tasks for role server1 and role server2
  • define role main playbook zack-role.yaml
  • run playbook for zack-role.yaml
  • Bingo! validate httpd on server1, and iftop & lrzsz installed on server2 by leveraging with ansible roles
